website_summaries.verdict: Customers looking for overall rodent control should check out this popular bait station.
pros: Tamper-proof stations come with one key
Bait is safely secured from pets and children
cons: More expensive than other bait stations

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open and doesn't work well in rain
customer_reviews.text: These things are extremely hard to open. The directions on how to open it make no sense. You have to insert the key into two key-holes at the same time, and then use the key to forcefully pry open the box. But guess what, it only comes with one key. That makes it really really hard to open. The box also doesn't stand up to rain very well. There are some drainage holes but they aren't in the right place. When it rains, the box gets filled up with water, which ruins the poison bait, and also gets full of mold.
customer_reviews.author: T. Girardi

customer_reviews.title: There are better options if you are looking to use them as ...
customer_reviews.text: We are a rodent trapping and prevention specialty company. We use them to put a Victor rat snap trap inside them so we can use snap traps inside a home without risk of kids and animals becoming trapped. There are better options if you are looking to use them as a bait box though as these are kind of tall and aren't that tough for long term outdoor use. We own 90-100 of them. I have no plans to look for anything else as they work perfect for my intended use. I would recommend buying them by the case not singly also
customer_reviews.author: James Knight

customer_reviews.title: A must if you have rats or mice around
customer_reviews.text: First. You need to get some paver blocks and construction adhesive. Glue these traps to the paver blocks. It will elevate them and keep the water out. It will also help prevent anyone (or anything) from moving your traps. Bait them with Farnam Just One Bite II 2-Ounce Chunks, 64 Count (a "super coumadin"), check them weekly and replace the bait blocks as necessary, and when there's no more nibbling on the bait, your rat problem is probably over. Keep the traps for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Tell It Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: I bought a case of 6 of these and of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a case of 6 of these and of the E-Z Klean stations and I cannot stand the lock and key system on these Protectas. They are too difficult to open compared to the other brand. If I didn't wait so long, I'd return them. Going to stick to the E-Z Klean boxes from now on.
customer_reviews.author: AMA

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLY DIFFICULT TO OPEN
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism is cheaply designed and results in you having to spend 5 minutes or more trying to pull it open, which is hard to do since they don't give you anything to grip onto. I suppose you could stick your fingers in the area where the rats walk thru and leave their rat poison crumbs, but I prefer to keep my hands far away from those places. I don't know why they didn't just use a standard locking mechanism I would have gladly paid a few extra bucks if it meant I didn't have to spend 5 minutes or more with each box. Opening these boxes is harder than a 5 piece furniture set from Ikea.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bokesch

customer_reviews.title: Rats and mice check in...you know the rest.
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problem opening the lid on the 18 I purchased. The middle space is perfect for one T Rex rat or mouse trap. I like how if you put bait cubes on just the rear metal rods, the rat has to come thruogh the T Rex rat trap kill zone. The mouse trap is smaller, so they can go around. My only gripe is there is no window. In the case of a rat, I can see their tail and rear outside of the box. A mouse you need to open the lid with the key. I bought 18, so yikes! Very happy with the design and the results so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allows your bait to become moist with the slightest rain.
customer_reviews.text: These bait stations allow the bait to become moist in the slightest rain. The key is very hard to use. I have bought many types of bait stations these are at the bottom of my list.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: These are HUGE, They allow rain and snow to get inside, ruining the bait. The boxes are sturdy, and key function is good - It would be nice if you got an extra key when you buy a pack of 6. Lose the ONE key and you are screwed. It's nice that it's dog/cat proof, but the very large opening was a problem for us weather wise.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself a ton of money and lay these poison boxes down yourself. I had a company come out and the charged me twice the amount of these bait boxes. Then wanted to charge me $75. to come out and rebait them. Buy the bait at a hardware store and do it yourself it’s very easy (once you figure out how to open the box).
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid bait stations.
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Easy to assemble. Good value. Bait fit perfectly. Honestly I’m not sure what everyone else was hung up on. I’m in SoCal and have two dogs - these are absolutely perfect and I’m comfortable having them in the backyard and along the house. They definitely work too - about a week or so after putting them in... you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Yes, the opening is a bit tricky but plan to simply use the key (inserted and pressed firmly into the slots) and a flat blade screwdriver, butter knife or something similar. You will quickly get the 'trick' and be able to open consistently. REMEMBER: this needs to be a bit difficult to open so that young children don't get into it ! My order arrived missing the key and metal rods. I contacted the seller and they immediately provided the replacement. Great customer service !
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Adam

customer_reviews.title: It Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: The key to open the lid is very short which makes it difficult to grip when apply the pressure necessary to release the catch lock and open the lid. I resort to using a flat face screwdriver to hold one side while I try to release the other lock latch. It should have a better design.
customer_reviews.author: bdmriderk9

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Rat Bait Station with lock
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and easy to load with bait blocks. The protecta sidekick also locks, which is a great feature to protect children and other who might tamper with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: HUDSON

customer_reviews.title: Functional but challenging
customer_reviews.text: Stores a good amount of bait so you won't have to restock for several months. Kid and dog proof as advertised. The only problem is they are very difficult to open, even with the included "key." I've found I need the key in one hand and a screwdriver in the other to pry them open.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, hard to use, no alternatives
customer_reviews.text: These are a real pain to use; the key never works properly; and they are ridiculously priced for a piece of stamped plastic from China. But what are you gonna do? Gotta protect the pets. I use them with warfarin, which is the least inhumane of the rodenticides, as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: New traps
customer_reviews.text: The bait traps work well. Perhaps because their new, they're a little hard to open. I have to use the key and a small flat screw driver to open them. But filling and closing is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K

customer_reviews.title: Safe for cats and dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We had a rat problem in the warehouse but needed rat bait stations that the cats could not get in. these work great. some bait stations are so small only a mouse could get it but an actual beefy rat can get in these.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult for animals to get in and you
customer_reviews.text: These work well and are very secure but they are terrible to access for yourself. I'd still buy them so that I don't risk my dogs health but there has gotta be an easier way to access these things.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to open with the supplied key but seems to be made out of durable plastic and should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Hieu

customer_reviews.title: Missing Keys
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch (6) of these stations but only got ONE KEY!! .. for six stations Which I lost. - Keys are an inexpensive stamped steel part. You should include a key with every station.
customer_reviews.author: JerryL59

customer_reviews.title: I love it but.....
customer_reviews.text: It works great but be careful what you want to control with it. The hole is large and allows the common grey squirrel to access. If you don't want to eliminate the grey squirrel and just mice and chipmunks, try another device or partially restrict the hole.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Too many flaws
customer_reviews.text: Tried very hard. Could not get the key to open. Holes too big (don't want dead accent squirrels in the yard). Also no peekaboo hole so we'll have to open every time to check the bait. Not worth for the amount of effort it takes to open the box
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: These work great. Open fairly easy with enclosed tool and close ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Open fairly easy with enclosed tool and close securely. These are fairly lightweight so if you set them in an area that gets much wind you’ll want to weight down with a rock or something. You’ll also be surprised at how fast the bait is consumed so keep extra baits handy and check weekly, especially in the fall
customer_reviews.author: DWVU97

customer_reviews.title: Poor locking system
customer_reviews.text: These are terribly hard to open if not darn near impossible. I am returning them. Very poor design for a locking mechanism and it is plastic, even if you could open and close them I dont see their locking mechanism as something that is going to last. (If you do lose your key you are in trouble. It would be difficult to open these even with a flathead.)
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband. He has been very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: G-Ma

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Well made ,very sturdy and I love the multi -pack.
customer_reviews.author: Chihuahuamom15

customer_reviews.title: read some reviews about the locking mechanism and key. ...
customer_reviews.text: read some reviews about the locking mechanism and key. you only get one key. you don't need two at the same time. First time is a little hard, but do what the directions say. Directions say the locking mechanism may be a little stiff when brand new. Opens right up - use a little forearm. then do the other lock, pull apart with fingers. Add your bait - done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty opening it with the key. I think there is a design flaw in the way the station is opened. However, once I watched the youtube video and tried very hard, it did open. Remember to wear a leather glove so not to hurt your hand when you exert the force to open it.
customer_reviews.author: G.N.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult and painful to operate
customer_reviews.text: Darned impossible to open. I own other boxes from different manufactures, and those others are easy to open, so I know it can be done. These are DIFFICULT. Hurt my fingers quite a bit. Also, rain water gets in, and I live in a rainy state. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: Ginne Miller

customer_reviews.title: Other brands are easier to open
customer_reviews.text: They are hard to open with the single key provided with the 6 bait stations.
customer_reviews.author: michelle g

customer_reviews.title: Made in the U. S.! I find ...
customer_reviews.text: Made in the U.S.! I find the key system time-consuming. I really needed a screwdriver in conjunction with the key, but it works and nothing is going to accidentally unlock them.
customer_reviews.author: clickity3

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and work well.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to open and put in the poison pellets. Opened one after a few weeks and most of the poison was consumed. The rodents are not around any more. I bought five of them and put them around my house.
customer_reviews.author: doclink

customer_reviews.title: Holds more blocks, with easy access for rodents;
customer_reviews.text: Holds more blocks than many units (we have a variety), with easy access for rodents; multi-packs perfect to cover a few homes and garages over 18 acres.
customer_reviews.author: CompletelyComputers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband says that it is the best. He uses it for all of our rental properties.
customer_reviews.author: melorie fields

customer_reviews.title: Just don't lose the key bc they are hard to open without which is a good thing if you have kids or pets
customer_reviews.text: Save money on the traps and you are your own pest control service. Just don't lose the key bc they are hard to open without which is a good thing if you have kids or pets.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Work fine - not that difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: These work fine. I was a bit wary about how difficult they are to open based on some of the reviews but pushing down with the key makes them open easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: Number1

customer_reviews.title: Great boxes and they worked well at one of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boxes and they worked well at one of my properties. I found the boxes to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: UP Powers

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality
customer_reviews.text: Just exactly like the exterminators use. Easy to fill and protective against larger animals and pets. Cuts down the populations to manageable sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Fess

customer_reviews.title: Best design but tough to open until they get worn in
customer_reviews.text: The boxes are really hard to open. I have other bait boxes and this style is the absolute best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you buy one bait station, you get a ...
customer_reviews.text: If you buy one bait station, you get a key. If you buy a pack of six bait stations, you get ONE key. Therefore, if you loose it, you have to b pay $4+ for extra keys. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: JPF

customer_reviews.title: although I don't think I will have a need anytime soon as a I expect they will hold up well for a good while.
customer_reviews.text: This boxes a very durable and worked well for our purpose, I would order again, although I don't think I will have a need anytime soon as a I expect they will hold up well for a good while.
customer_reviews.author: John Chavarria

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: compact and gives you the ability to place rat poison in a container that your dogs, cats, rabbits can't get at. only drawback is the key they supply to open the box to refill does not work by itself and I must also use a screw driver to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Be your own exterminator!
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 of these suckers and filled them with Tomcat bait Chunx to keep the mice from my barn and my house. Works well. Same deal that is used in professional exterminators' business.

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: No instructions on how to open the trap, it's so difficult to open
customer_reviews.author: foghat

customer_reviews.title: I know a guy who owns a pest control company ...
customer_reviews.text: I know a guy who owns a pest control company and he said that he uses these bait stations for his business.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C Coelho

customer_reviews.title: hold with concrete block
customer_reviews.text: these are good, but important to anchor to house or to use heavy concrete. important to keep children safe !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband tells everyone about this trap and the Contrac ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband tells everyone about this trap and the Contrac Blox Rodenticide that he uses with this trap. Since we have several acres of land he has several traps and very rarely do we see rats/mice or their droppings.
customer_reviews.author: Trust Me

customer_reviews.title: Work great if you can get them open...
customer_reviews.text: These things are a bitch to get open, but load them with the soft bait and they're great.
customer_reviews.author: AmBarbazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know until after I put them out that they were not meant to be used with critters. I only used a few days because raccoons wanted to steal them. They need to be heavy enough so critters can’t drag them.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Initially a bit hard to open with key.
customer_reviews.text: Had to look up on Youtube to see how to open it since no instructions provided. Once you know how to open it it's not that hard, but the complete lack of any instructions was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This a a great tamper proof mouse bait station. I was worried about my dogs getting into the rat poison, but these are very sturdy and I do not think any larger animal could get these opened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love how this is working and how quickly the package came

customer_reviews.title: Works fine in my barn - hard to open though
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Assembles easily. Very hard to open the first few times. So it will be very hard to open for the first few fillings.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a great price. Works great. Only bad thing is it's hard to open.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about 30 of these so far. Nice product for the money

customer_reviews.text: High quality boxes...don't lose your key though. Seems to be getting used too, and the tree rats in my area seem to have disappeared with the bait I'm using.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friend of my mom's and they swear it took care of all the rats that appear after the road construction started. Prevents pets from eating the poison.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TRAP
customer_reviews.text: make sure you use the pins, and the mice or rats can not carry the bait off. they will die with good bait that have holes in the middle.

customer_reviews.title: Rats gone
customer_reviews.text: Got the trap and baits. The rats love the bait. neatly in and out of the trap. they walked right by the peanut butter on the traditional trap to go for the bait!
customer_reviews.author: raafter

customer_reviews.title: Beware of (some) sellers!
customer_reviews.text: Good product, safe from prying hands and clearly puts the bait where vermin can get at it. Watch your cart at checkout time; some sellers' "Free Shipping" is a bald-faced lie.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, cheaper material.
customer_reviews.text: Not constructed as well as I would have thought but overall does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Protecta Sidekick Rat/ Mouse Bait Station
customer_reviews.text: They work well, I just would like the entry holes were a little larger. And it takes some practice unlocking and locking the lid.

customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog or cat this is the best trap to use

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Fair at best...size are not geared for mice but for rats

customer_reviews.title: Great bait station
customer_reviews.text: This is a LARGE and STURDY bait station. The 6 pack comes with ONE key so make sure to not misplace it. The bait station holds 8 blocks of bait on metal rods that will keep the pest from removing the bait from the box. There are additional anchoring holes in the enclosure that allow you to secure the box itself to the location to keep larger animals from moving the bait stations.

customer_reviews.text: Living next to a creek has drawbacks. I hope rat problem solved. Without killing other critters around like Birds and squarils

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: fast shipping, great price, got rid of my roof rats, used the "just on bite' few days, found 4 dead rats, i have continues to bait these traps, i tried everything and this was the only thing that worked, no problems so far so good, would recommend product, thank you again amazon

customer_reviews.title: They are rugged but were difficult to figure out the technique for using the key to open them but after loading 6 of them and ch
customer_reviews.text: I bought a six pack of these to put around the perimeter of my house. I also bought the big container of bait. I check them every few weeks and twice half the bait was gone out of two of them so I know they are working. They are rugged but were difficult to figure out the technique for using the key to open them but after loading 6 of them and checking a few times it is easy enough.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Rodents use it. During first 6 weeks, all bait was consumed. Stations are very hard to open. I cut one of the 2 latches off to make it easier to open.

customer_reviews.title: baited with and it seems like they work pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to fight mice and rats, baited withand it seems like they work pretty good. Found a few dead just 2 days after installation. I did not have to attach them to anything, just put a heavy rock on top :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: They are Baits
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertise. Easy to open and re-fill. They can flow around so you might need to secure them down or add some rocks to them.
customer_reviews.author: henry lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Immediate Results & Safe for my pets
customer_reviews.text: Don't pay a Pest Control Service to use these same Bait Stations and charge you double.. DIY Safely and Cheaper... We live in a coastal area on the edge of a city park - so we have our share of field mice and fruit rats.. Place some of these around the perimeter of your home and areas you know they scurry across regularly.. And within 2-3 days you will see results - trust me :) p.s. - we also have wild bird feeders to unfortunately enhance our chances of these vermin - but these still do the job without another thought.. :)
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Next to Impossible to Open
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst products I've purchased from Amazon. Admittedly, i am old and not as handy as some, but I can't get these open, neither can my wife. Ended up throwing them in the trash as not worth the hassle and aggravation. Buy something else!!!!
customer_reviews.author: FloridaHokie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The 6 stations came with NO KEY. No I have 6 worthless plastic boxes! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to open
customer_reviews.text: I like having a lock on the unit but they were almost impossible to open. One unit had a plastic piece on the locking mechanism that broke when I opened it so the durability is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: ToxEagle

product_meta.title: 6 Protecta Sidekick Tamper Proof Rat / Mouse / Rodent Control Bait Stations with 1 Key ~ Kill Mice and Rats!! Bait Sold Separately BELL-1035cs
product_meta.description: The compact Protecta Sidekick is a prudent way to upgrade from non-tamper-resistant bait stations to a more durable tamper-resistant station. The Protecta Sidekick functions as both a bait station and monitoring station. It's vertical bait securing rods hold bait blox securely in the station, reducing the risk of accidental bait exposure to children, pets and non-target animals. The Protecta Sidekick also works as a monitoring station and it is specially designed to hold Trapper T-Rex Rat Snap Trap which captures rats as they enter the station. The lid on this bait station opens to the side for fast, convenient servicing, even when the station is secured and its rounded interior corners make cleaning the station easier than ever. bait and trex traps are sold separately
feature_bullets: 6 protecta sidekick tamper proof bait stations with 1 Key

Special Features: Works as both a bait station and a monitoring station, vertical bait securing rods, locks when closed, opens to the side for fast, convenient servicing, rounded interior corners make cleaning the station easier than ever, built-in card slot holds the Protecta service card, ideal for fitting into tight baiting locations
Color: Black; Material/Construction: Impact-resistant, injection-molded plastic
Pet safe: Is tamper resistant and locks when closed, but bait should always be kept out of reach of children and pets.
Parts Included: One Protecta 2-prong key per order, four vertical bait securing rods

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars191 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
